Body: Description: Internal vulnerability team has identified a recently discovered vulnerability in Apache Struts is affecting our Stealthbits/Enterprise Auditor installation. The CVE mentions there is a newer version of the package that resolves it, but as it was part of the software installation I am not sure how to resolve this. Is Netwrix aware and/or working on a hotfix? C:Program Files (x86)STEALTHbitsStealthAUDITActionsSurveyWebServletWEB-INFlibstruts2-core-6.3.0.2.jar Reference Links: https://securityonline.info/cve-2024-53677-critical-vulnerability-in-apache-struts-allows-remote-code-execution https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2024-53677 https://cwiki.apache.org/confluence/display/WW/S2-067

@Mike Candon​ - please follow the procedure for handling a vulnerability report:

https://nwxcorp.sharepoint.com/sites/NetwrixTechnicalSupport/SitePages/T1-Support-Engineer-Handbook.aspx?OR=Teams-HL&CT=1734456093740&clickparams=eyJBcHBOYW1lIjoiVGVhbXMtRGVza3RvcCIsIkFwcFZlcnNpb24iOiI0OS8yNDEyMDEwMDIxMSJ9#reporting-a-security-concern

Confirmed with Ethan Israel in SWAT that if the customer is not currently using the NEA Survey Action module, the offending file can be removed:%SAInstallDir%ActionsSurveyWebServletWEB-INFlibstruts2-core-6.3.0.2.jar
What We've Learned Updated: Customer is not using the NEA Survey action module which is the only thing that uses the apache struts binary
Next Steps Updated: Let customer know they can remove the offending file to mitigate the vulnerability

On Escalation Ticket # 00430399 the new comment has been added: Michael Burrofato: @Salesforce @Ethan Israel The vulnerability has been patched. Patch will be available in the next scheduled CU (01/31/2025).

Next Steps Updated: Issue has been remediated in the customer environment as they removed the offending apache struts file (not using/licensed for Survery AM).

A patch has been released in NEA v11.6.0.132+, which now uses Apache Struts 6.7.0. Customer has been notified of this, we are waiting to hear back if they'd like assistance upgrading.
